author: cherrypie
title: Re: Decision on ceasefire up to Duterte—Dureza
text:
INQUIRER.net / 12:22 PM February 01, 2017 President Rodrigo. AFP FILE PHOTO / NOEL CELIS 
“We leave the decision to the President,” said Presidential adviser on the peace process Jesus Dureza on Wednesday hours after the New People’s Army (NPA) announced the termination of the unilateral ceasefire. READ: After attacks, NPA ending ceasefire — rebel official 
The peace adviser said the announcement in a speech in Cagayan de Oro. 
Dureza, however, said he would recommend to President Rodrigo Duterte to maintain the ceasefire on the part of the government. ADVERTISEMENT READ: Communist rebels to terminate unilateral ceasefire 
Dureza, however, said he would recommend to President Rodrigo Duterte to maintain the ceasefire on the part of the government. 
But despite this, he said state forces should “continue addressing lawless acts on the ground and suppress lawless violence and continue protect the people.” 
He said the NPA was taking the President to task for not meeting their demands to release all political prisoners. But Duterte, he said, could not just order their release since they were facing criminal charges. RAM
